active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate how SOC 2 physical security controls (CC6.4) address real-world threats like tailgating or insider threats in a shared data center. Connect to the CIA triad and propose one improvement for a hypothetical non-compliant facility.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in SOC 2 Physical Security Controls (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Physical and Facility Security Design > Compliance and Standards > Industry-Specific Regulations > SOC 2 Physical Security Controls). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning components, 4-layer scaffolding, and flashcard schema to create optimized Anki-style flashcards promoting Bloom's progression, active recall, and spaced repetition. Key Content Sources: AICPA SOC 2 TSC (CC6.1: secure architectures; CC6.2: user access; CC6.4: physical access restrictions to facilities/data centers/backup media); NIST SP 800-53 (PE family); ISO 27001 (A.11 Physical/Environmental); best practices (perimeters, CCTV, badges, logs, tailgating prevention, equipment maintenance). Prior knowledge: CIA triad, basic access controls. Incorporate: - Learning objectives for measurable outcomes. - Scaffolding: Distribute cards across Layers 1-4. - Active elements: Embed discussion/problem-solving hooks in scenario cards. - Schema: Q/A, MCQs (distractors per protocol), cloze, scenarios; each with explanation + metadata (Bloom level, Layer, Type). Generate exactly 40 flashcards in JSON array format: [{'front': '...', 'back': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'layer': 1-4, 'type': '...'}]. Ensure completeness (no truncations), pedagogy (higher-order thinking), and misconceptions addressed. Vary difficulty progressively.
